sub_title: VP and Head of Engineering Brachy Solutions at Elekta
summary:
Strong collaborative results driven senior leader with extensive knowledge and experience of multidisciplinary product creation processes, medical devices, complex (mechatronic) systems, clinical procedures, standards & regulations, technology transfer, IP protection, outsourcing, and modern product development & manufacturing processes. Substantial senior management experience in concept explorations, product engineering, and project management from different international organizations in various heavily regulated industries and academic setting. 

NPD, medical device development, radiopharmaceutical manufacturing, automotive engineering, GxP, GMP, GDP, GAMP, system verification, process validation, MSA, SPC, aseptic manufacturing, sterilization, clean rooms, medical isotopes, sealed source manufacturing, DFSS, FTA, DoE, PPAP, APQP, IAEA, ISO 13485, IATF 16949, IEC 60601, IEC 62304, medical imaging, packaging & labeling, scientific research, statistics (SPSS, Amos, PLS-SEM, Minitab), R&D-related grants, change management, sociotechnical systems, organisational behaviour.

education.field_of_study: 3D-CAD,  Catia V4; a.o. solid design, advanced surfaces, installation & administration

school.name: HAN University of Applied Sciences (Hogeschool van Arnhem en Nijmegen)

profile_positions.title: VP and Head of Engineering Brachy Solutions

profile_positions.description:
Overall responsibility for the concept exploration and design quality of Brachytherapy products and solutions. Leading in the selection and prioritizing of technologies necessary for the creation of concepts for new products. Chairmanship of the Brachy Exploration Council. Guidance and technical mentorship to engineers, physicists, managers and external parties in the creation and development of designs. Member of the Patent Review Committee, owner of treatment delivery technology roadmap, and advising senior management, VP R&D, and CTO.

•	Implemented the use of new technologies to improve the product creation process.
•	Coached project managers, systems engineers, physicists, product managers, medical affairs, RA, suppliers and customers to ensure project progress and a proper release of new product developments. 
•	Guided engineers and physicists during the development of treatment delivery devices.
•	Drafted technology roadmaps and aligned implementation with stakeholders.
•	Concepts created and patented for new workflow enhancing applications.
•	Knowledge transfer to competent authorities.
•	Writing of research proposals, and grant applications (e.g. WBSO).
•	Supervising students, reviewing of draft publications, and PhD dissertation.
•	Moderator of innovation demos.
•	Member of NEN commission (radioactivity), and ISO working group (sealed sources).
profile_positions.title: Chief Engineer -Brachytherapy

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for feasibility studies, new product developments and R&D product lifecycle activities of the complete product portfolio related to Brachytherapy treatment delivery devices. Leading the R&D development teams of mechanical engineering, electronic engineering, software/firmware development, service engineering, and system verification. (In total up to 33 fte, of which 9 direct reports.)

•	Department staff policy, budget, hiring and outsourcing. 
•	Guided engineers, project managers, and suppliers with design, verification and validation activities for new skin cancer treatment delivery system (Esteya) and obtained CE approval in June 2013.
•	Guided and supported suppliers with the designs, improvements, and validations of new processes for the manufacturing of sealed radioactive sources (I-125, Ir-192, Co-60).
•	Improved technical files/DHFs and successfully passed numerous audits (e.g. Dekra, FDA, CFDA, Anvisa).
•	Advised MT, VP R&D and senior product management with plan of approach for concept exploration, product development, and product lifecycle activities.
•	Managing of external partnerships and knowledge transfer. 
•	Implemented a reorganization.
profile_positions.title: R&D Director Devices - Brachytherapy

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for feasibility studies, new product developments and R&D product lifecycle activities of the complete product portfolio related to Brachytherapy treatment delivery devices. Leading the R&D development teams of mechanical engineering, electronic engineering and integrated systems, including project managers, system engineers, software engineers, firmware engineers and external contractors. (In total up to 32 fte, of which 26 direct reports.)

•	Department staff policy, budget, hiring and outsourcing.
•	Guided engineers, project managers and supplier how to solve tough issues related to EMC shielding and the development of a new therapeutic X-ray tube. 
•	Guided project managers, engineers and external parties to develop and release the Flexitron Co-60 system, incl. all accessories and the manufacturing process of Co-60 source production.
•	Guided the product development and release of a new software application for HDR brachytherapy.  
•	Made the portfolio compliant with high impact regulations like RoHS-2 and 60601-3rd edition.
•	Designed and patented radioactive source which can cope 100.000 transfers easily (Co-60).
•	Various software releases and HW updates for improvements of Real Time Prostate, microSelectron, Simulix and IBU.
•	Improved Flexitron Ir-192 system, initially designed by Isodose Control B.V.
profile_positions.title: Development Manager Treatment Delivery

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for quality, progress and budget of Capex/Opex projects for radiopharmaceutical production, reporting to MT and board.
Submitting and presenting of project plans and capital expenditure requests for approval of Covidien MTs (NL, UK and USA). Compose multidisciplinary project teams and managing multiple projects that are carried out simultaneously. Initiate product and process improvements, cost saving projects and use of new technology. Managing feasibility studies and predevelopment phases of new products and processes. Managing design processes (DFSS, SPC), risk assessments (HAZOP, FMIA, JSA), tests (FAT, SAT), qualifications and validations (IQ, OQ, PQ). Support with submitting of permit applications and guidance of notified bodies and supervisory authorities. Knowledge transfer, negotiating and selection of suppliers. Setting up test methods and guidance of qualification, validation and release processes. 

•	Designed, implemented and validated a large robotized system for packaging and distribution of isotopes.
•	Specified, purchased, implemented and validated autoclave system, environmental monitoring system, and label printing system.
•	Specified, purchased, implemented and validated HVAC systems for radiological controlled areas. 
•	Designed new packaging for isotopes acc. to IAEA regulations.
•	Submitted proposal and concept design for major renovation of a large Mo-99 processing plant.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for quality, progress and budget of new development projects, reporting to professor Medical Technology at Academic Medical Center. Directing 12-19 product development technicians. Dialoguing with surgeons, doctors, physicians, clinicians, scientific researchers, professors and external manufacturers for setting up requirements and developing of new medical instruments, systems and equipment for scientific research. Initiating new developments, generating new concepts, concept selection and feasibility studies. Selection, hiring, assessments and phasing out employees, advising of PhDs, and coaching of students. Monitoring compliance of regulations, OH&S and environmental policies. Setting up department procedures, monitoring FMEAs and verification of draft user manuals. Review of technical files and approval of (CE) declarations of conformities.
Setting up annual/multi-annual department plans, incl. investment budget requests. Support with scientific publications, clinical trials, applications for research funds, patent applications and technology transfer. 

•	Computer controlled cryomicrotome with image processing and analysis for cardiology.
•	Mechatronic equipment for application with Ultrasound, MEG, CT and MRI.
•	Various new systems and tools for scientific research, radiotherapy, biotechnology, urology, and  cardiology.
•	New surgical instruments, catheters, trocars, needles, and manipulators for minimally invasive surgery (e.g. for Storz, Baxter and MDi).
•	6 DOF fiber optic force sensor for fMRI application.
•	Mechatronic system for diagnostics of the wrist joint (4D-CT imaging), STW / Philips Medical.
•	Pin SPECT rotational device for Nuclear Diagnostics AB.
•	Selection and implementation of web-based proj. adm., CAD-CAM (Inventor, Solid Works & Hypermill), and CAE (Ansys & RayCAD).
•	Submitted proposal, incl. business case of 5 years, to director of divisional mgt. to privatize the department due to adapted financing model in healthcare.
profile_positions.title: Groupleader Medical Technological Development deptm.

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for product engineering of automotive sunroofs, reporting to MT and board.
Compose project teams, prioritize activities, distribution of work and monitoring progress.
Alignment of multiple internal and external project teams during NPD and engineering.
Support marketing and sales with new developments and quotations. Technology transfer with HQ in Germany and subsidiaries in UK and USA. Instruct and verify results of test dept. and manufacturing departments. Release of manufacturing equipment and processes. Selection, hiring and annual assessments of employees. Determine vision of product engineering process, writing plans and implementing new methods. Writing, implementing and monitoring of R&D procedures according to QS9000 (TQM) and ISO-9001. Control of outsourced design and engineering activities.

•	Developed a new series of top-slider sunroofs that more than doubled the company’s turnover.
•	Convinced the owner of the company and the management of Ford of Europe AG to develop a folding roof for the Ford-KA, which resulted that the company became an OEM supplier.
•	Founder and chairman of PPI (Product & Process Improvement) team.
•	Benchmark, selection and implementation of 3D-CAD (Catia/AIX) and VRML mfg. instructions.
profile_positions.title: Head Product Engineering

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for quality, progress and budget of product development projects, reporting to R&D director.
- Project planning and managing multidisciplinary project teams. 
- Setting up design layouts of new sunroofs and integrated systems. 
- Initiating pre-engineering tests and selection of materials and manufacturing processes.
- Setting up and updating product costs calculations and technical construction files.
- Verifying and approve specifications for ordering production equipment.
- Production preparation and release of toolings for serial production. 
- Knowledge transfer to/from European suppliers, manufacturing sites, R&D colleagues, marketing-, sales-, purchasing and financial departments.
- Contacts with various European suppliers, e.g. BASF, Ticona, Alcoa, Saint Gobain, SWF, Valeo, Polynorm, Wientjes, AMP, Nedap, Axxicon, Alverpak.
profile_positions.title: Projectmanager / Lead Designer

profile_positions.description:
- Generating new concepts and draft design layouts of large and complex assemblies.
- Design and mechanical engineering of sunroof systems according to ISO-9001, a.o.;  drive systems,  mechanisms, electronic systems, integrated frames, large interior covers, wind deflectors, sun blinds.
- Calculations of: strength, stiffness, creep, relaxation, product performance and service live expectations, amongst others by means of FEM.
- CAD system management (ME10 / HP-UX).
- Components, e.g.; various plastic injection molded parts, fiber reinforced plastic pressing (SMC), zamak and aluminum casted parts, silicon & aluminium extrusion parts, large deep drawn steel parts, metal stamped and rolled stainless steel parts, CNC bended and CNC machined parts, multiple curved glass panels and various packaging materials.
profile_positions.title: Designer

profile_positions.description:
- NPD & engineering of automotive sunroof parts and subassemblies.
- Design and engineering of new manufacturing equipment.
- Setting up of product specifications; 2D-CAD drawings and technical datasheets.
- Strength and stiffness calculations.
- PC system management.
profile_positions.title: Designer-Draftsman
